page.title: 10Landscape of Featherstone
page.content: The mining town of Featherstone with its pit stack and headgear is situated amid the green fields of arable farms. We visited the village of Ackton in the NW in order to have a good view of most of the area.Looking from Ackton the landscape is more agricultural than industrial except to the north where huge pylons dominate the land carrying electricity cables from the power stations to the east.All round the village the views are a pleasant green because so much of the land is covered with cereal crops and it is June .The landscape changes with the time of year and growth of crops.To the SE is a grassed pit stack which hides the town of Featherstone from view,this is being removed to infill the opencast site to the south.On it's eastern side the stack is bare soil.
